message.content:
<<<api>>>: ImageReader
<<<code>>>: 
try {
    File tiffFile = new File("path_to_your_tiff_file");
    ImageInputStream is = ImageIO.createImageInputStream(tiffFile);
    Iterator<ImageReader> iterator = ImageIO.getImageReaders(is);
    if (iterator.hasNext()) {
        ImageReader reader = iterator.next();
        reader.setInput(is);
        IIOMetadata metadata = reader.getImageMetadata(0);
        String[] names = metadata.getMetadataFormatNames();
        int length = names.length;
        for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            System.out.println( "Format name: " + names[ i ] );
            Node node = metadata.getAsTree(names[i]);
            if (node.getNodeName().equals("javax_imageio_1.0")) {
                NodeList children = node.getChildNodes();
                for (int j = 0; j < children.getLength(); j++) {
                    Node child = children.item(j);
                    if (child.getNodeName().equals("Compression")) {
                        Node value = child.getFirstChild();
                        if (value.getNodeValue().equals("CCITT T.6")) {
                            System.out.println("This is a Group 4 TIFF image.");
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads the metadata of the TIFF image using ImageIO's ImageReader. It then checks the compression type in the metadata. If the compression type is "CCITT T.6", it means the TIFF image is Group 4.
